intro: Erycibe coccinea, commonly known as the red erycibe, is a tropical plant native to regions of South America. It is a climbing vine that produces striking red flowers with yellow stamens. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant color and unique appearance. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
